channel.title: PC still broke
channel.description:
Ok, right board now, i just got my mobo back and my computer was still in the same condition that it was in originally, broke, so the mobo is good, its proc or ram, the more i fuck with it the more i think its ram, 1 stick in top slot, BSoD instantly, other one, windows boots and runs fine, 2 sticks, windows boots but there are lines horizontally across the screen. if it is ram, 1 stick works fine still. If you think its the proc, stop here and tell me please.
If you think it is ram, pwnd-"Again, it's generally better to have the same brand/size/speed/etc. as the original stick(s).", Would i notice any significant slow down if i were to go with just 1 more stick since 1 stick still works? I am going with the same size if i do, 2 gigs, speed is average, so speed should be same too, but brand might be diff.

item.title: PC still broke
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Not the ram timings, ive got them set at the advertised, same as before my system crashed. atm i am running fine, i increased some shit in bios, cant remember what it was but one from 200 to 1000 and one from 8^ 8v to 16^ 16v. I still only have 2 gigs of ram though, i found another stick and tested it, if i opened my computer with that stick in also then the screen would blue a bit and tonnes of horizontal lines popped up. ATM i am gunna keep it how it is, I really need to rma the ram though. I am about 70% sure the proc is fine now, i am assuming the other stick i tried was shot too.

Read full topic

item.title: PC still broke
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

If the BSOD happens to say “IRQ_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL” it could be the ram timings in your BIOS. I once added a new stick of ram to the machine, and kept getting those BSODs, but after increasing the ram timing it worked just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: PC still broke
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So removing the video card fixed everything in your dads computer… (except for the fact that this person may not have onboard video, so removing the video card would make him not able to attach it to a moniter…)

Read full topic

item.title: PC still broke
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Hitting it won’t fix anything, if one stick of RAM works and the other doesn’t, it is obviously the one stick of RAM that is bad. Either just run the one, or get another of the same type and speed (brand or size doesn’t matter, but if it is pc100, you need another of pc100, not pc133 for example)

Hitting/removing the video card fixed everything in my dads computer.

Read full topic

plexiglass side, dont wanna smudge/scratch it lol, video is integrated atm, mobo is 100% brand new

item.title: PC still broke
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Hiaburi:

Tried finding ram, couldn’t. No one I know has any that would work, new symptom i notices is my sound crackles and my video laggs, even runescape laggs.

Have you tried hitting the side of the computer(should fix the sound), or getting a new video card(might fix the rest of your problems)?

Read full topic

item.title: PC still broke
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

I think it is the ram. Try it by finding two older (smaller) sticks of ram and putting them in. If they both work, go and buy 2x2gb sticks. If they don’t, your computer is strange.

Read full topic
